data.title: Trying to rearrange open files causes odd selection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
Related to #5060
1. Open 2 files side by side
2. Grab the top bar of the file (not on the title) and try to move it straight over to the right 

![rearrangewindows](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14336394/39393eda-fc18-11e5-9f53-9aa837673ec2.gif)

data.title: Rearrange split view files only working if grabbing the title
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

A hand icon is showing when hovering over the top of an open file but it will only let you grab the window to rearrange if the mouse cursor is over the title of the file.

data.title: Close button is not visible all the time in side by side editing.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Launch app and open two files for side by side editing.
2. Adjust the position of the editor area and verify close button.

Actual: Close button is hiding when user adjusting editor view area.
Expected: File close button should be visible all the time.

![animation1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14335835/3511124c-fc13-11e5-9f77-eea6c35e6a68.gif)

data.title: Convert to Tab/Spaces toggles render whitespace after saving
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file
2. Turn on toggle render whitespace
3. Convert tabs -> spaces or spaces -> tabs
4. Save

Actual:
Toggle render whitespace is turned off after saving.

data.title: Paste whole line after a bracket does not correctly indent
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha (latest)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Place cursor/caret at the end of a line and copy to copy the whole line
2. Navigate to the end of a line with an open bracket
3. Paste

Actual:
Does not correctly indent the next line after pasting:
![noindent](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14335365/6b2103fa-fc0f-11e5-8bd6-a9bb89cfcef5.JPG)

Expected:
In VS2015 it will indent the pasted line after the bracket.

data.title: diffEditor.renderSideBySide false shows two columns of line numbers
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.14 code-insiders
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set "diffEditor.renderSideBySide":false
2. Select a Git controls file with changes
   You will see two columns of line numbers in the left editor gutter.

data.title: ES6 error property declarations
Related to JS #3509 Javascript Completion fails if 'exports' is qualified with 'module'
Build task is not saving the changes before building the project.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: windows10

Note: I am taking error scenario with non-existing file to under this issue correctly.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open ts project from  https://github.com/v-pavanp/ForTestingCode/blob/master/TypeScript.zip location.
2. Now update tasks.json file by providing  args value as "app.ts" and save the changes and build (CTRL+.Shift+B) it.
"args": ["$app.ts"],
3. Verify error message.
error TS5007: Cannot resolve referenced file: 'app.ts'.
4. Now update the args value to "app1.ts" and build it without saving.
"args": ["$app1.ts"],
5. Verify error message in the output window.
error TS5007: Cannot resolve referenced file: 'app.ts'.

Expected: 
error TS5007: Cannot resolve referenced file: 'app1.ts'.

Actual:
When user trigger build operation without save then build task is not performing save before build operation hence result is showing up for old value.

In the below screenshot I updated args value to app1.js and performed build without saving.
I could see the result is showing up for app.js.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14333131/f93ca666-fc01-11e5-91f1-b6d72f85f837.png)

data.title: Search highlighting in some themes could be improved
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha (latest)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Search for something that occurs in a file many times
2. Click between the results in the same file.

Actual: 
Very low visibility that your selection has changed between the results in the same file.

![searchselection](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14333322/f791fff4-fc02-11e5-8838-ffc7015f107e.JPG)

Also with the Solarized Light theme some text is almost unreadable when selected by search
![searchunreadable](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14333358/28dbf5ce-fc03-11e5-8224-d873bf4f0051.JPG)

data.title: Intellisense activating inside of strings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10

(Code examples will be in C#, but also repro's with other languages)

Scenario 1 Repro:
1. `var x = "%%`
2. With the cursor at `%%`, Type `C`
3. Code Completion suggestions are shown.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10519323/14332053/be020618-fbfc-11e5-97d1-668ce22db799.png)

Scenario 2 Repro:
1. `Console.WriteLine("%%)`
2. Intellisense will be showing. Click elsewhere in the file to dismiss it.
3. Type `(`
4. Intellisense is shown again.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10519323/14332327/e327a668-fbfd-11e5-867c-2dcffad8a61d.png)
(This would be normal if it hadn't been previously dismissed.)

data.title: Cannot validate php file Info popup should have option to open settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a php file 
2. Dialog pops up saying "Cannot validate the php file"

Expected:
Most other warnings ask if you would like to open the config file.
![phpconfig](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14330474/91f0351a-fbf5-11e5-89ec-989e0aae554e.JPG)

data.title: [Errors on OS X] - Error from the extension host: channel closed AND Extension host terminated unexpectedly. Please reload to recover.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. All I have to do is open Visual Studio Code and it will give me these error. I am not able to save, and some of the keyboard commands don't work such as backspace.

Troubleshooting:
1. I've deleted all my extensions from `~/.vscode/extensions` but still experience the same errors.
2. I've completely uninstalled VS Code by using App Cleaner to make sure I got every app file possible, yet it still gave errors after I installed a fresh copy from the website. 

Screenshot:

![Screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/Pkq7kmC.png)

**EDIT:** Actually... I think I may have found the issue. This happens when I open a remote file from within FileZilla by right clicking on the **remote** filename and clicking on view/edit. What this does is open the file in VSCode and shows the temp location of the file as a very long string.

I feel like it may be this that is causing the issue because after downloading the file and **then** opening it, everything is working fine. 

Is there any log that I can submit to see if I'm right?

data.title: Automatically fill "files to include" when opening search

milestone.title: Backlog

data.title: Support to scroll markdown preview with source scrolling
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.14 code-insiders
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a markdown preview to the side of markdown source
2. Scroll source file

It would be nice to have a way to lock the preview and scroll at the same time.  Especially nice for longer markdown files.

This came in from an internal MS writer using VS Code for Markdown.

data.title: Files with .es6 suffix are treated as TypeScript files
Printing support

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'm interested in support for printing out code files.

Is there a way to cause the editor to render the full file into the DOM (as opposed to only the visible set of rows)? That seems like the main hurdle.

data.title: Keeping arrow down in editor is not very fluid
data.body:
When I have a larger markdown file (or any file) and I press and hold arrow down to scroll down, I see some issues:
- CPU goes up to 30% which seems weird for such an operation
- the selection highlighter updates very hectic (this explains the CPU spike)
- the whole scrolling noticably slows down and is not very snappy

I wonder if selection highlight and find match highlight should update buffered in this case to make the scrolling fluid and less UI hectic.

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/14326280/96186dbe-fc2d-11e5-8183-0ca94eb097fa.gif)

data.title: Salsa does not warn undeclared variable
data.body:
Before Salsa was implemented, when I write like this without define `foo`:

``` javascript
console.log(foo);
```

VS code can give a hint warning that  `the variable foo is not defined`

While after update to 0.10.11,  salsa won't do this. How can I get this feature back?

PS: The ts server I'm using is `1.9.0-dev.20160128`

data.title: Can't view missing module name when path is too long
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  0.10.11
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. start a project in a long path: eg /Users/accountname/work/my-project
2. require a file with the full path: var x = require(__dirname + "/file.js"),
3. launch your app and you'll get an exception with a character limit used up by the folder structure

![screen shot 2016-04-06 at 9 47 30 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2373805/14323163/ab03e6e6-fbdc-11e5-91ba-af8032feee00.png)

Maybe the project's root directory could be truncated from the exception messages?

data.title: Linux update notifications
data.body: Related to #4400

data.title: Webview: very hard to resize editor
data.body:
For some reason our sash between editors is not clickable if you try to grab it from the web view side:
- have a web view in slot 2
- move with the mouse from slot 2 towards 1 to grab the resize handle
- you can only grab it when you are outside the web view

It does not seem to be related to the z-index, because the sash has a z-index of 100.

Any clues?

1. yo code, create a TypoeScript project
2. npm on the new fodler
3. Open vscode on the new folder
4. In the debug viewlet run the tests
5. A window opens, and when closing closes also the main window

data.title: Command line open a same file twice, generate two windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  0.10.11
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In Terminal, type "code ~/.profile" will open the window with .profile.
2. Type "code ~/.profile" again, a new window will open with the same .profile file. It should resume the window in step 1.

data.title: fix missing semi colon, and remove double task terminateProcess
data.body: I don't know if the task need to be started twice, I also added a missing semi colon to the hygiene gulp task.

data.title: Scrolling a Markdown document eats 100% cpu, spawns empty cmd.exe processes,
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  0.10.11
- OS Version:
  Win 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create an md file and paste the following block multiple times so you can scroll the document:

```
## lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet

```
1. Hold down arrow and watch processes

![markdown-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16809885/14315700/475ef18a-fbff-11e5-86d1-f208c5fee245.png)
